action.primary: Warms the Kidneys and astringes Jing and urine

indications: Frequent and copious urination, urinary incontinence and spermatorrhea or dribbling of urine due to Kidney Yang Deficiency

action.primary: Warms the Spleen, increases the appetite and stops diarrhea and salivation

indications: Spleen and Stomach Yang Deficiency with diarrhea, Cold abdominal pain, excessive salivation and a thick, unpleasant taste in the mouth
Abdominal pain, vomiting and diarrhea from Cold entering the Spleen and Kidneys

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with spermatorrhea, frequent urination, vomiting, diarrhea or vaginal discharge due to Heat.
Contraindicated for those with Blood Dryness from Fire.
Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency Fire.

useCases: Urinary incontinence, or frequency due to Kidney and Spleen Yang Deficiency.
Vomiting, diarrhea, Cold and pain in the abdomen, decreased appetite and excessive salivation from a Cold Deficient Spleen and Stomach.
Abdominal pain, vomiting, and diarrhea from Cold entering the Spleen and Kidneys.
Prevents development of Heat from Deficiency as a side effect.
Warms and contains the Kidney Qi so that it returns to its source.
Secures the urine to treat Lower Jiao Deficiency Cold with incontinence, urinary frequency or urinary dribbling. (worse in the presence of Cold)

notes: Fr. Alpiniae Oxyphyllae Yi Zhi Ren is used for excessive salivation and a thick, unpleasant taste in the mouth due to Cold while Hb. Eupatorii #{PeiLan} Pei Lan is used for the same symptoms due to Heat.
It can be used alone as a powder for uterine bleeding.
It is often used with Ootheca Mantidis #{SangPiaoXiao} Sang Piao Xiao.
This herb was traditionally used to enhance intelligence and mental faculties.

Both Yi Zhi Ren and Fr. Psoraliae #{BuGuZhi} Bu Gu Zhi tonify the Spleen and Kidneys, fortify Yang, stop diarrhea, astringe Jing and urine and are commonly used to treat Spleen and Kidney Yang Deficiency. Bu Gu Zhi Primarily warms the Kidneys thereby indirectly warms the Spleen Yang. It treats chronic diarrhea and cock-crow diarrhea due to Spleen and Kidney Yang Deficiency. It also treats lower back pain. Yi Zhi Ren more strongly warms Spleen Yang, and secondarily warms the Kidneys to treat diarrhea associated with with the exposure of the Spleen and Stomach to Cold. it also treats uterine bleeding.

Salt-prepared Alpinia Yan Yi Zhi Ren has reduced acrid and drying properties and directly enters the Lower Jiao to astringe Jing and urine. It is often used to treat Kidney Yang Deficiency with spermatorrhea, nocturnal emissions, incontinence, terminal dribbling and nocturia.
